title: Security Concerns: Saved forms (across VMs) and password (after clearing all history).
content:
v155.9.1esr Debian 12

Security issue #1: I'm testing different debian 12 on multiple VMs, it came to my surprise to see that my VPN hash I used on a website the day before was saved by Firefox on the new VM.

The Sync was on but then which one saved my form (hash):

  1. Numbered list item Logins & Passwords ? note: The hash was not a login but a form. If Firefox saves all the form, you should explicitly rename Logins by any forms/inputs.
  2. Numbered list item History? note: I hope this is only URLs.

Security issue #2: After realizing the above, I deleted all my cache and history from the History menu. Then I toggled Sync by "Sign[ing] Out" and forcing "delete all data from this device (password, bookmarks, etc.)". That closed Firefox. Then thinking this would be a clean version, I realized that my bookmarks were gone, so I decided to enable syncing again only for the bookmarks. When the prompt asked for my login which I entered (My email) but then my password was still saved (masked but still saved).
